page.title: 02Horticulture at Longtown.
page.content: This is quite a good area for gardening in that the winter climate is not so severe as more easterly parts of the county. Most plants grow well,particularly Rhododendrons and other ericaceous plants as it is mainly an acid soil in the area.Spring bulbs such as Narcissi do well and also vegetables,as can be seen by the excellent display of them at the Annual Flower Show. The damper climate has its drawbacks;in summer,Potatoes are often attacked by Blight,unless treated with a preventive fungicide;in winter,plants of the Dianthus family,and Alpine plants,often die off as they do not like cold,damp conditions at ground level. Longtown Horticultural Society,although not large,has some very keen members,and holds talks,visits and outings.
